page.title: 01SOUTH EDINBURGH
page.content: An attractive block of large {residential}houses gradually expanded south to the city edge.Many of these houses have been converted to make small flats, hospitals,hotels and old folks homes. In the centre the large{hills}of the Braids and Blackford have been preserved, with the unspoilt steep valley of the Hermitage with its{burn and} {woodland.}With{Golf Courses}and farmland around, the Royal Observatory and the University's King's Buildings enjoy splendid surroundings. Riding stables near the Braids make good use of the bridle paths. With the new huge Shopping Centre, the area is well served with shops. There are few indoor sports facilities.On the whole, an excellent{high amenity area}with no major factories or industry.
